page.title: 02Common Land (1)
page.content:
Hungerford Common is 191 acres of grassland with Oak,Ash,Beech,Elm and Sycamore trees,Holly and Blackberry bushes,wild flowers with rabbits running freely.Through it runs a main railway line connecting London with the West Country,gated roads with four exits which all have cattle grids by the side.The Kennet and Avon canal and river Kennet,prolific with trout, flow through.At the Inkpen there is a small wooden pen where the animals are rounded up at the end of the grazing season.The common is a local beauty spot where families picnic and is a favourite place to exercise dogs.
From April until mid-November up to 170 head of cattle graze, in March the land is fertilized and harrowed,this is paid for by the Trustees.
